docTitle.titlePart:
Acyl-und Alkylidenphosphane, XV [1]
2.2-Dimethylpropylidinphosphan, eine stabile Verbindung mit einem
Phosphoratom der Koordinationszahl 1

front.note:
Acyl-and Alkjdidenephosphines, XV [1]
2,2-Dimethylpropylidynephosphine, a Stable Compound with a Phosphorus Atom
of Coordination Number 1

byline.docAuthor: Gerd Becker*, Gudrun Gresser und Werner Uhl

front.div:
In the presence of small amounts of solid sodium hydroxide, [2,2-dimethyl-l-(trimethyl-
siloxy)propylidene]-trimethylsilylphosphine
reacts at + 20 °C to give hexamethyldisil-
oxane and 2,2-dimethylpropylidynephosphine
(2). In contrast to similar alkylidyne-
phosphines this compound is stable at room temperature. The IR and mass spectrum are
discussed, and 1 H, 13 C and 31 P NMR spectral data are given.
